query: We require an insulated GDMI housing in Syrafast Stainless Steel (SF / 316) for a marine chemical plant (C5-M). Airflow: 3400 mÂ³/h. Please provide the code.

turns.content: We require an insulated GDMI housing in Syrafast Stainless Steel (SF / 316) for a marine chemical plant (C5-M). Airflow: 3400 mÂ³/h. Please provide the code.

**Important:** SF (stainless steel) is **not available** for GDMI. Available material options: Aluzink AZ185, Zinkmagnesium ZM310. Please select an available material to proceed.This configuration for the marine chemical plant application is blocked. The GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.Additionally, the GDMI housing has a C4 corrosion class, while marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance. The presence of salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion, causing C3-rated materials to fail prematurely. High humidity will also accelerate zinc corrosion, reducing the service life of the housing. Finally, outdoor installation can cause condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need a fully-welded construction and C5.1-rated materials. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.To proceed with the GDP protector stage, I need to know the filter depth for the 600x600 module. Also, what are the minimum expected ambient temperature and typical relative humidity at the installation site? This information is needed to assess the risk of outdoor condensation.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical product constraint (GDMI is not available in stainless steel) and a safety constraint (C4-rated housing is unsuitable for a C5-M marine chemical environment). The engineering reasoning regarding corrosion and construction types is sound. The only minor flaw is the abrupt transition to asking about a 'GDP protector stage' which the user did not request, but the primary safety block was handled perfectly.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly states that GDMI is not available in stainless steel (Verified against PDF p.11 'Ej i Rostfritt').
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the material unavailability and environmental unsuitability, though the pivot to 'GDP protector stage' is slightly confusing contextually.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks a C4-rated product for a C5-M marine chemical application, preventing potential catastrophic corrosion failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, appropriately directing the user to custom engineering.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Excellent derivation of the conflict between the product's C4 rating and the application's C5 requirement, supported by valid construction analysis (bolted vs welded).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the specific catalog rule that GDMI cannot be made in stainless steel.

strengths: Accurately caught the 'Ej i Rostfritt' (No Stainless) exclusion for GDMI on page 11
Sound engineering logic regarding marine/chemical environments requiring C5/welded solutions
Correctly identified the corrosion class mismatch (GDMI is C4, application is C5)
weaknesses: Confusing transition to asking about 'GDP protector stage' parameters without explaining why the conversation shifted to a pre-filter
pdf_citations: GDMI: 'Ej i Rostfritt' (Not in Stainless) (PDF p.11)

content_segments.text: **Important:** SF (stainless steel) is **not available** for GDMI. Available material options: Aluzink AZ185, Zinkmagnesium ZM310. Please select an available material to proceed.

This configuration for the marine chemical plant application is blocked. The GDMI family is not suitable for marine environments due to its bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.

Additionally, the GDMI housing has a C4 corrosion class, while marine/coastal environments require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance. The presence of salt spray accelerates zinc corrosion, causing C3-rated materials to fail prematurely. High humidity will also accelerate zinc corrosion, reducing the service life of the housing. Finally, outdoor installation can cause condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces.

Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need a fully-welded construction and C5.1-rated materials. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

To proceed with the GDP protector stage, I need to know the filter depth for the 600x600 module. Also, what are the minimum expected ambient temperature and typical relative humidity at the installation site? This information is needed to assess the risk of outdoor condensation.
